page.title: 17Dunmore (cont)
page.content: One resident we interviewed said that she had had a hard life. She had often gone without shoes and eaten no dinners at{school.}Those times were hard but now she misses her grandchildren. Elsie has enjoyed life at Dunmore for 4 years and told us that her favourite pet was a{toy poodle.}The oldest male resident thought that Matron treated him well. His favourite area is the garden where he grew his roses. His favourite animal is a spaniel and he shares a room with two friends. Reading, walking and eating seemed to be popular pastimes. {Dumplings and stew}were liked as were {fish and chips. Our stay was mixed with happy thoughts of animals and songs and sad memories of life changing.
